refnamediv.refpurpose: SSH client plugin for connecting to AF_VSOCK and AF_UNIX sockets

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting: ProxyCommand /usr/lib/elogind/elogind-ssh-proxy %h %p Host unix/* vsock/* vsock-mux/* ProxyUseFdpass yes

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: elogind-ssh-proxy is a small "proxy" plugin for the ssh1 tool that allows connecting to AF_UNIX and AF_VSOCK sockets. It implements the interface defined by ssh's ProxyCommand configuration option. It's supposed to be used with an ssh_config5 configuration fragment like the following:
refsect1.programlisting:
ProxyCommand /usr/lib/elogind/elogind-ssh-proxy %h %p Host unix/* vsock/* vsock-mux/* ProxyUseFdpass yes CheckHostIP no
Host .host ProxyCommand /usr/lib/elogind/elogind-ssh-proxy unix/run/ssh-unix-local/socket %p ProxyUseFdpass yes CheckHostIP no
refsect1.para: A configuration fragment along these lines is by default installed into /etc/ssh/ssh_config.d/20-elogind-ssh-proxy.conf.

With this in place, SSH connections to host string unix/ followed by an absolute AF_UNIX file system path to a socket will be directed to the specified socket, which must be of type SOCK_STREAM. Similar, SSH connections to vsock/ followed by an AF_VSOCK CID will result in an SSH connection made to that CID. vsock-mux/ followed by an absolute AF_UNIX file system path to a socket is similar but for cloud-hypervisor/firecracker which do not allow direct AF_VSOCK communication between the host and guests, and provide their own multiplexer over AF_UNIX sockets. See cloud-hypervisor VSOCK support and Using the Firecracker Virtio-vsock Device.
Moreover connecting to .host will connect to the local host via SSH, without involving networking.

This tool is supposed to be used together with elogind-ssh-generator8 which when run inside a VM or container will bind SSH to suitable elogind-ssh-proxy is run on the host, in order to connect to the container or VM addresses. elogind-ssh-generator is supposed to run in the container or VM guest, and guest.

refsect1.title: Exit status
refsect1.para: On success, 0 is returned, a non-zero failure code otherwise.
